subject: Re: New file uploaded to EVP-ITC
author: SCampbel72
full_text:
Kristin,

When I played your clip, right after you ask, "is this radio used as 
a portal?" I hear the reply "THIS RA-DI-(pause)-O"  then you break 
with "I'm sorry, say again".  Then it continues in a broken beat, "A-
POR-TAL OF " some distortion then I hear the word "WAVES" but it is 
soft. Then after that there is a pause, the I can hear "YES IT" but I 
didn't hear does before it cuts off..

That is what I heard in my office using speakers. I have found I 
sometimes hear things different in headphones vs speakers. 

Steven C


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Kristin Morris" <ckmorris95@...> 
wrote:
>
> Oh yeah.. one more thing..  You really don't hear anything more 
than the YES
> IT DOES at the end?  This is killing me.. I can hear them so 
clearly and I'm
> boggled every time someone says they don't hear it as I do. Oh 
well.  I'll
> keep trying for better audio.
> 
> K (more determined than ever! ;-)
> 
>  
> 
>   _____  
> 
> From: EVP-ITC@...m [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On 
Behalf Of
> itcdeadpeople
> Sent: Friday, March 28, 2008 10:46 AM
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: New file uploaded to EVP-ITC
> 
>  
> 
> Hi Kristin. I can hear the "yes it does" part. I looked up some of 
the
> meanings of the word 
> 'portal' and found this:
> 
> "A portal in fiction is a magical or technological doorway that 
connects two
> distant 
> locations."
> 
> I suppose in this regard the 'ghost boxes' or radios used in sweep 
with the
> intent of 
> communication could be considered a portal of sorts, but if that is 
the
> case, then wouldn't 
> our digital recorders (which can be used by those in spirit to 
produce EVP
> even when it is 
> not our intent) and televisions, camcorders, ordinary cameras, etc 
(used by
> those in spirit 
> to show their images, again, with our without our intent) also be 
portals? I
> recently got an 
> EVP voicemail from my next door neighbor's mother, saying her name, 
and when
> reversed, 
> the message is "I love you." So I guess we'd have to toss 
telephones and
> computers onto 
> the list as well.
> 
> I think the truth is, those in spirit can (and do!) basically go 
wherever
> they want, whenever 
> they choose, and do not require our permission or our technology to 
do so.
> The only thing 
> the technology does is allow us to be aware of their presence, 
which in many
> cases would 
> have gone by unnoticed, if not for our use of the equipment. 
> 
> Just my thoughts on the subject. :0)
> 
> Margaret
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups <mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com> .com,
> "Kristin" <ckmorris95@> wrote:

as a
